meanings.definition: To form a bad or unsuitable alliance.
meanings.sent1: The two countries misallied and faced many disagreements.
meanings.sent2: The business misallied with a dishonest partner and suffered losses.
meanings.sent3: The cats misallied in their plan to catch the mouse, ending up chasing each other instead.
meanings.sent4: The misallied teams struggled to work together, like oil and water.
meanings.sent5: The misallied friendship quickly fell apart due to conflicting interests.

meanings.definition: To be in an unsuitable or incompatible alliance.
meanings.sent1: The nations misallied and found it hard to cooperate.
meanings.sent2: The company misallied with a rival, causing tension in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The misallied group of friends tried to plan a trip but couldn't agree on anything.
meanings.sent4: Their misallied partnership was like trying to fit a square peg in a round hole.
meanings.sent5: The misallied duo struggled to see eye to eye on important decisions.
